creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
inscription: L edge: 人間之真諦　如屁如煙幻　顕現怱消 {Ningen no shintei, johi joen gen, kengen sōshō} (The ultimate truth of humankind is something fleeting like a fart or like smoke, it manifests and dissipates)
markings: ULC, rectangular relief stamp; LL, square intaglio stamp: 士恭恪印; LL, square relief stamp: 不如学; LLQ, in child's hand, rectangular intaglio: 此画此時一談一笑; inscribed label on top of rolled scroll
title: Skeleton Father and Son Doing the Bon Dance
